title.value: Correction: Economic evaluation of the effect of needle and syringe programs on skin, soft tissue, and vascular infections in people who inject drugs: a microsimulation modelling approach
title.justification: The paper is a correction notice for the original article titled "Economic evaluation of the effect of needle and syringe programs on skin, soft tissue, and vascular infections in people who inject drugs: a microsimulation modelling approach."
title.quote: Correction: Economic evaluation of the effect of needle and syringe programs on skin, soft tissue, and vascular infections in people who inject drugs: a microsimulation modelling approach

extractions.description: This document is a correction notice for a previously published research article that evaluates the economic impact of needle and syringe programs on various infections in people who inject drugs, using a microsimulation modelling approach.

type.justification: The original research involved a microsimulation modelling approach, which suggests theoretical analysis.
type.quote: Economic evaluation of the effect of needle and syringe programs on skin, soft tissue, and vascular infections in people who inject drugs: a microsimulation modelling approach.

name.justification: The research is conducted within the Department of Epidemiology, Biostatistics, and Occupational Health and involves health-related modelling.
name.quote: Department of Epidemiology, Biostatistics, and Occupational Health, McGill University

name.justification: The research has implications for public health through harm reduction programs.
name.quote: Economic evaluation of the effect of needle and syringe programs on skin, soft tissue, and vascular infections in people who inject drugs
